name: Classic War Movies Trivia Game | Classics - Average 10 | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Breaker Morant" is set during the Boer War. Why is Harry Morant known as "Breaker"?
questions.correct: He was a breaker of horses
options: He was a breaker of women's hearts
questions.explanation:
He was a breaker of horses.

	Interesting movie of the "war is hell" type.

questions.text: Which of these World War I movies is based on a novel by Dalton Trumbo?
options: All Quiet on the Western Front
questions.explanation:
Johnny Got His Gun.

	Trumbo, a member of the "Hollywood 10" (and talented screenwriter of "Spartacus") wrote this anti-war novel. "York" was Gary Cooper'smovie. "Front" was by Erich Maria Remarque.

questions.text: "The Charge of the Light Brigade" describes an infamous blunder during the Crimean War. What is unusual about this movie?
questions.correct: Errol Flynn stars with Olivia DeHavilland - but doesn't end up with her at the end of the movie
options: Errol Flynn & Olivia DeHavilland are both in the movie, but never have a romantic relationship
Errol Flynn jilts Olivia DeHavilland for another woman
Olivia DeHavilland dies in the movie
questions.explanation:
Errol Flynn stars with Olivia DeHavilland - but doesn't end up with her at the end of the movie.

	Olivia prefers Flynn's brother (in the movie) - so Flynn doesn't lose as much when he rides "into the valley of Death". (Re-made later with David Hemmings in the lead.)

questions.text: Which movie is NOT set during the Korean War?
questions.explanation:
Hell to Eternity.

	Anyone who has watched the tv series knows that "MASH" was set during the Korean War. "Pork Chop Hill" starred Gregory Peck; "Toko-Ri" starred William Holden. "Hell" starred Jeffrey Hunter (and David Janssen), but was set in WW II.

questions.text: In "Four Feathers", a young man proves his courage by performing heroic deeds. Where?
questions.explanation:
The Sudan.

	There are several versions of this story - but they don't get better with time. Good story.

questions.text: Which one of Hemingway's novels uses the Spanish Civil War as a backdrop for romance between Gary Cooper and Ingrid Bergman?
options: The Old Man and the Sea
questions.explanation:
For Whom The Bell Tolls.

	Its age is showing.

questions.text: Who starred in the movie version of "The Red Badge of Courage"?
questions.explanation:
Audie Murphy.

	War hero Murphy starred in the movie version of the Stephen Crane novel. (There have been other versions since.)

questions.text: "The Last of the Mohicans" is set during the French and Indian War. Daniel Day-Lewis starred in the remake; who played his romantic interest?
questions.explanation:
Madeleine Stowe.

	Stick to the original - (Randolph Scott in the mid 30's).

questions.text: Cary Grant starred in a movie version of "Gunga Din". Who wrote the poem of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Rudyard Kipling.

	Remarque wrote the classic "All Quiet on The Western Front".

questions.text: The anti-war World War I film "Paths of Glory" takes its title from a line from a poem: "the paths of glory lead but to the grave". Who wrote these lines?
questions.explanation:
Thomas Gray.

	Gray's "Elegy Written in a Country Courtyard". He was right.
